page.title: 08World War II
page.content: The first bombing occurred in central Gorleston during 1941. Children were evacuated away from the town, schools were closed,the population fell considerably, few vehicles other than for military purposes were on the streets, which became untidy. As access to the coast from France and Belgium was likely security was enforced in the area, by use of identification cards. The town became a focal point for daytime air raids on Germany, and as many as 1000 aircraft would collect in the sky above the area. Gorleston beach was mined and barbed wire and anti aircraft guns were were placed along the coast, and a high gun tower was erected near the ferry. There was the constant fear of invasion or bombing, particularly since the port was used by the Royal Navy.
